programme.title: How to See Through Fog: a portrait of a mining town in its darkest days
programme.desc: Queenstown, on the remote west coast of Tasmania, is known for two things: copper mining and the harsh gravel oval that is home to the local Australian rules football team. A series of deaths at the Mount Lyell mine brought operations to a standstill and put the future of the town in doubt.

programme.title: Lord of the Rain: one man's fight against climate catastrophe
programme.desc: Doyte lives in South Omo, Ethiopia, one of the most remote areas in the world and hard hit by the climate crisis. As Lord of the Rain, it’s Doyte’s job to summon the rains, but for five years they haven’t come.

programme.title: How Cape Town stopped the taps running dry | Middle Earth: the fight to save the Amazon's soul
programme.desc: Day Zero: how Cape Town stopped the taps running dry | Wrangling Russia: the American cowboys heading east

programme.title: United Voices
programme.desc: As work in the UK gets more precarious and the gig economy booms, trade unionism is being reimagined and people from a wide range of backgrounds are joining new kinds of unions, often for the first time.

programme.title: Life in the Arctic | The poets taking on climate change
programme.desc: Life in the Arctic: how climate change is killing a culture | High ice and hard truth: the poets taking on climate change

programme.title: Crossing the line
programme.desc: Episode one: Khaled's Ladder | Episode two: The story of Civil Rights is unfinished

programme.title: America's Dirty Divide
programme.desc: No water, no life: running out of water on the California-Oregon border | The 'gift of God' that has poisoned American kids for 100 years

programme.title: Why?
programme.desc: Why Bitcoin is so bad for the planet | Why we are all attracted to conspiracy theories

programme.title: Canada's Music Cities
programme.desc: Canada's Music Cities

programme.title: It's Complicated
programme.desc: How British colonialism increased diabetes in south Asians | How Israel created a water crisis for Palestinians | How Russia is taking control of the Arctic | How cruise ships became a catastrophe for the planet

programme.title: On the Ground
programme.desc: Inside a frontline Ukrainian field hospital | Don't cry, I'm here now': free after eight years in an Israeli prison

programme.title: Desert Fire
programme.desc: Football’s world cup for unrecognised territories is viewed through the eyes of the manager and players of one of the most fascinating teams, Iraqi Kurdistan.

programme.title: Second innings
programme.desc: From Afghanistan to London, three boys build a new life playing cricket. Tucked away in suburban south London, matches take place every week for young and often traumatised asylum seekers.

programme.title: Can women save sumo? The crossroads facing Japan's national sport
programme.desc: The ancient Japanese sport of sumo is in well-documented crisis. Years of controversy and scandal have hurt the sport's ability to attract new talent.

programme.title: Inside the mission to create an army of Greta Thunbergs
programme.desc: Melanie Harwood is an education entrepreneur and self-styled 'disruptor', who has partnered with the United Nations to educate teachers about climate change. The Guardian's Richard Sprenger joined her on a trip to Dubai, to witness her unorthodox approach first hand

programme.title: Inside the strange world of NFTs
programme.desc: Celebrities, sports people, politicians – anyone and everyone seems to be getting into NFTs. These non-fungible tokens (NFTs) have changed the business of buying, selling and owning art and digital property, and 'collectibles' like 'Bored Apes' have sold for millions online.

programme.title: The Night Wolves: Putin's motorbiking militia of Luhansk
programme.desc: The Night Wolves are Russia’s largest and most notorious biker gang, fiercely loyal to Vladimir Putin, and say they are motivated by Christianity and patriotism.

programme.title: The secret disinformation team who distort reality | Ilya: the AI scientist shaping the world
programme.desc: 'Team Jorge' unmasked: the secret disinformation team who distort reality | Ilya: the AI scientist shaping the world

programme.title: Fighting addiction on Pine Ridge reservation
programme.desc: Whiteclay, Nebraska is a tiny unincorporated town that sits on the border with South Dakota.

programme.title: Should we abolish private schools? | The Afghan girls fighting to go to school
programme.desc: Should we abolish private schools? | Banned by the Taliban: the Afghan girls fighting to go to school

programme.title: Burned to the Ground: the Canadian village incinerated by record temperatures
programme.desc: The small village of Lytton in British Columbia hit the global media when it smashed Canada's highest temperature record in June 2021, at 49.6C. Two days later, a wildfire burned the entire village to the ground.

programme.title: Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria | The Yamuna, India's most polluted river
programme.desc: Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria: 'We're American, too, why don't they help?' | The Yamuna, India's most polluted river

programme.title: Inside Out: Indigenous imprisonment in Australia
programme.desc: Filmed on the plains of north-western New South Wales, this documentary looks at one man's fight against the scourge of Indigenous imprisonment in his community.

programme.title: Guardians of the Gibbons
programme.desc: For over a century the villagers of Barekuri, north-east India’s biodiversity hotspot, have coexisted with the country’s only ape species, the hoolock gibbon. But this harmony stands in fragile ecological balance.

programme.title: Happy birthday
programme.desc: For years, global music publisher Warner/Chappell claimed copyright of the Happy Birthday song, demanding payment for any public performance of it.

programme.title: Crannog
programme.desc: Alexis has a life-threatening disease. She spends her time in the wooded expanse of northern Scotland, where she takes care of dozens of animals who are also sick, wounded or dying.

programme.title: Beirut Dreams in Color
programme.desc: Mashrou’ Leila were one of the biggest bands in the Middle East, with a lead singer, Hamed, who is the most prominent openly gay rock star in the Arab world. Known globally, their gigs were regular sell-out successes until an event at their 2017 Cairo concert changed everything.

programme.title: America's soccer migrants: the US footballers crossing Mexico's border
programme.desc: Despite President Donald Trump’s rhetoric about Mexicans crossing the border to the US, American soccer players such as Omar Gonzalez are heading south for new opportunities, more money and a better standard of football.

programme.title: How to See Through Fog: a portrait of a mining town in its darkest days
programme.desc: Queenstown, on the remote west coast of Tasmania, is known for two things: copper mining and the harsh gravel oval that is home to the local Australian rules football team. A series of deaths at the Mount Lyell mine brought operations to a standstill and put the future of the town in doubt.

programme.title: Autism rocks: meet the boys from The AutistiX | What it's like to find out you’re autistic aged 33
programme.desc: Autism rocks: meet the boys from The AutistiX | What it's like to find out you’re autistic aged 33

programme.title: The secret world of Asian drag queens | Oklahoma rodeo: 'I can be gay and I can be a cowboy'
programme.desc: Getting rid of the beard is a challenge: the secret world of Asian drag queens | Oklahoma rodeo: 'I can be gay and I can be a cowboy'

programme.title: Working nights to pack your California strawberries, working days to graduate from school
programme.desc: Ashley Solis is a Mexican American teenager, farmworker and factory worker who dreams of being the first in her family to graduate from high school and go to college. Her mother is undocumented, and like many families with mixed documented status, they face the threat of family separation.

programme.title: The UK's first professional trans choir: 'It's a joyful act of resistance'
programme.desc: Anil Sebastian and Coda Galabov are the creators of a new choir called Trans Voices, which offers a space for trans and non-binary people who have felt unable to sing with their true voices in traditional choirs.

programme.title: Four weddings
programme.desc: Not all weddings are about marrying a prince. This documentary tells the story of four special weddings around the world from the point of view of the bride.

programme.title: Cinema of Ukraine: artists reflect on modern history, culture and people
programme.desc: The Guardian is celebrating Ukrainian cinema with a specially curated selection of documentaries, made before the current war.

programme.title: The Hour of Lynching - vigilante violence in India
programme.desc: Rakbar, a Muslim dairy farmer, was murdered by a Hindu mob who thought he was taking a cow to be slaughtered for meat.

programme.title: Meet the brewers of the craft beer revolution | Neuro-cuisine: exploring the science of flavour
programme.desc: Meet the brewers of the craft beer revolution | Neuro-cuisine: exploring the science of flavour

programme.title: 'Revenge pornography': Chrissy Chambers' search for justice
programme.desc: In April, it became a crime in England and Wales to post ‘revenge pornography’. Chrissy Chambers and her girlfriend Bria are YouTube’s most popular lesbian content creators.

programme.title: Leonora Carrington: Britain's lost surrealist | Rembrandt's portraits at the National Gallery
programme.desc: Leonora Carrington: Britain's lost surrealist | Love and loss: Rembrandt's portraits at the National Gallery

programme.title: The pioneering New York prison program transforming lives | Keeping Panini alive in the digital age
programme.desc: Writing wrongs: the pioneering New York prison program transforming lives | Meet the stickerheads: the people keeping Panini alive in the digital age

programme.title: Speak your mind
programme.desc: Three-part series about body image, mental health and wellbeing.

programme.title: Meet the artists
programme.desc: Sarah Lucas | Laura Prouvost

programme.title: Off The Page
programme.desc: PPE | Devil in the Detail | School Gate

programme.title: Europeans
programme.desc: Ireland: The world needs to get more Irish | Poland: 'Borders bring fear and distrust' | Spain: Europe's one big scam

programme.title: This is the NHS
programme.desc: The great British booze problem for the NHS | Knocked down, spat at and trampled on: another day in A&E

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - Guardian Cities
programme.desc: Guardian Cities: Pyongyang calling: we spent a week in North Korea | Guardian Tokyo week: Looking for cheap rent? Try a haunted house

programme.title: Why?
programme.desc: Why your memories can't be trusted | Why we should be paying more for parking

programme.title: Protests in Africa's last absolute monarchy | Western Sahara: the last colony in Africa
programme.desc: The last king of Eswatini? Reporting on protests in Africa's last absolute monarchy | Western Sahara: the last colony in Africa

programme.title: Should we abolish private schools? | The Afghan girls fighting to go to school
programme.desc: Should we abolish private schools? | Banned by the Taliban: the Afghan girls fighting to go to school

programme.title: Is this inclusive? Why only 4% of children's book heroes are BAME
programme.desc: More than 33% of students at UK schools are from black and minority ethnic backgrounds, but only 4% of the protagonists in children's books in the UK are BAME.

programme.title: The "Spider-Man" of Sudan: the real-life superhero of the protest movement
programme.desc: In Sudan's capital, Khartoum, an anonymous protester dressed as Spider-Man joins the hundreds of thousands of protesters desperate to protect their fragile civilian government after the military coup in October 2021.

programme.title: The Fight
programme.desc: People with disabilities are among the most discriminated against in Bolivia. Fed up with being ignored, a group of them march across the Andes to the seat of the government in La Paz, asking to speak to President Evo Morales. They are met with riot police, barricades, teargas and water cannon.

programme.title: Police Brutality: the families left behind | What does it mean to defund the police?
programme.desc: The families left behind after police killings: 'You never get over losing a child' | What does it mean to defund the police?

programme.title: Daisy Chain: Can a Cornish town adapt to survive another lockdown?
programme.desc: When the remote town of St Just, Cornwall, was locked down in March 2020, the small community worried that its economy wouldn't survive.

programme.title: The Mexican women who kicked out | Mumbai's all-female taxi firm | Veiled rapper breaking taboos
programme.desc: The Mexican women who kicked out the cartels | Drive for women's empowerment: Mumbai's all-female taxi firm | The veiled rapper breaking taboos for women in Senegal

programme.title: My Brother's Keeper
programme.desc: Mohamedou Ould Salahi and one of his former guards, Steve Wood, reunite in Mauritania 13 years after last seeing each other, rekindling an unlikely relationship that profoundly changed their lives.

programme.title: "I want to bring up a warrior": Ukraine's far-right children's camp
programme.desc: In Ukraine, the far-right Azov militia is fighting on the frontline – and running a summer camp for children.

programme.title: The only way out is through Jesus: The El Salvador pastors saving MS-13 gang members
programme.desc: In El Salvador, where brutal gangs like MS-13 and 18th Street have given the country the world’s highest murder rate, the only way out for members is to become born-again Christians.

programme.title: Guantánamo Diary | The quest for the perfect male six-packs
programme.desc: Guantánamo Diary: rendition, torture and detention without charge | Steroids, syringes and stigma: the quest for the perfect male six-packs

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation.

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTN's brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the world's most powerful laser and the world's smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. An international team of reporters will follow the guidance of Occam's Razor - the principle that the simplest explanation is the best one. RAZOR will show that we are already "living in the future"!

The content focuses on exciting new trends, fashion, and cultural topics across a range of disciplines both in China and abroad. The host presents various culture-related topics in a fun way while also doing some in-depth analysis to give viewers a fuller picture as to what is happening, and why it matters.

programme.title: Global Business
programme.desc: Global Business is the flagship business show of CGTN English Channel, bringing you the latest economic data, business trends and policies.

programme.title: Africa Live
programme.desc: Africa Live is a news program that focuses on African issues and issues related to this diverse continent. CGTN's Nairobi-based broadcast center produces Africa Live.

programme.title: Global Business
programme.desc: Global Business is the flagship business show of CGTN English Channel, bringing you the latest economic data, business trends and policies.

programme.title: The World Today
programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the world's top stories as they happen.

programme.title: World Insight with Tian Wei
programme.desc: World Insight with Tian Wei is a long-running international platform for debate and intelligent discussion.

programme.title: The World Today
programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the world's top stories as they happen.

programme.title: Dialogue
programme.desc: It is a prime time daily English talk show on CGTN.

programme.title: Global Business
programme.desc: Global Business is the flagship business show of CGTN English Channel, bringing you the latest economic data, business trends and policies.

programme.title: The Hub With Wang Guan
programme.desc: The Hub with Wang Guan covers hot-button geopolitical and economic issues, as well as interesting stories and trends in culture, education, technology and lifestyle. It aims to connect people, cultures and societies across the East and the West. The program features dynamic designs, fast pace and rich visuals to keep viewers engaged. It also makes use of trending topics online, while focusing on what’s relevant in China and the world.

programme.title: The World Today
programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the world's top stories as they happen.

programme.title: Rediscovering China
programme.desc: Rediscovering China is a half-hour documentary program on CGTN. Each edition offers unique insight into various aspects of life in China today. With unrivalled access to the country's people and places, the program aims to show the global audience an inclusive and vigorous China.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Robin i Mullet rozpoczynają ambitny projekt przyjazny dla środowiska, a Bill przekonuje się, że interesy i przyjaźń nie zawsze idą w parze.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Robin próbuje przekonać kolekcjonera samochodów do sprzedaży rzadkiego pojazdu, Bill liczy na to, że nowy pracownik przywróci ważny projekt na właściwe tory, a Peter ma problemy z silnikiem.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia S2 Ep4
programme.desc: Zaczynają się targi; Todd i Bri przygotowują najlepsze klejnoty na sprzedaż. Mifsudowie podejmują się kolejnej dużej pracy konserwacyjnej. Richardsonowie z powodu pogody muszą wrócić na starą działkę.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Craig LeBeau i jego ekipa rozbijają obóz w odległej części Shuswap Highlands. Tymczasem Brent oczyszcza drogę dla skuterów śnieżnych na zlecenie lokalnego ośrodka narciarskiego.

programme.title: Królowie złomu
programme.desc: W West Yorkshire stara wieża szkoleniowa straży pożarnej rozpada się — trzeba ją rozebrać. W Cheshire na złom ma trafić barka rzeczna, ale najpierw trzeba wydobyć ją z wody.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Szyper Squizzy realizuje plan popsucia szyków swojemu rywalowi, Bryce'owi. Bryce wykorzystuje stary rybacki przesąd i chce przejąć cenne łowisko Snoddy'ego.

programme.title: Taaaki karp!
programme.sub-title: S08 : E03 Gigantica Road Lake, Francja
programme.desc: Tom i Neil wyruszają na słynne komercyjne łowisko Gigantica Road Lake we Francji; zwykle wędkują razem, ale tym razem po raz pierwszy rozdzielają się i łowią po przeciwnych stronach jeziora...

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Robin próbuje przekonać kolekcjonera samochodów do sprzedaży rzadkiego pojazdu, Bill liczy na to, że nowy pracownik przywróci ważny projekt na właściwe tory, a Peter ma problemy z silnikiem.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E07 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep7
programme.desc: Katastrofa budowlana w Miami prowadzi do narodowej żałoby. W środku Ottawy w Kanadzie powstaje ogromna dziura. Jeden z najsłynniejszych mostów świata w Kalifornii robi straszny hałas.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia S2 Ep4
programme.desc: Zaczynają się targi; Todd i Bri przygotowują najlepsze klejnoty na sprzedaż. Mifsudowie podejmują się kolejnej dużej pracy konserwacyjnej. Richardsonowie z powodu pogody muszą wrócić na starą działkę.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Craig LeBeau i jego ekipa rozbijają obóz w odległej części Shuswap Highlands. Tymczasem Brent oczyszcza drogę dla skuterów śnieżnych na zlecenie lokalnego ośrodka narciarskiego.

programme.title: Królowie złomu
programme.desc: W West Yorkshire stara wieża szkoleniowa straży pożarnej rozpada się — trzeba ją rozebrać. W Cheshire na złom ma trafić barka rzeczna, ale najpierw trzeba wydobyć ją z wody.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Szyper Squizzy realizuje plan popsucia szyków swojemu rywalowi, Bryce'owi. Bryce wykorzystuje stary rybacki przesąd i chce przejąć cenne łowisko Snoddy'ego.

programme.title: Taaaki karp!
programme.sub-title: S08 : E04 Lac du Der-Chantecoq, Francja
programme.desc: Neil i Tom stają przed wyjątkowym wyzwaniem: wyruszają nad wielkie sztuczne jezioro, aby spróbować złowić naprawdę wielkiego karpia. Największy osobnik złowiony tu w 2021 r. ważył ponad 46 kilogramów.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Glen i Robin zgadzają się na nietypowe zawody. Bill kupuje zabytkowego Cadillaca, który wydaje się być w doskonałym stanie — niestety po zdjęciu lakieru okazuje się, że to nieprawda...

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia S2 Ep5
programme.desc: Ray podejmuje się zadania przecięcia ogromnego kamienia. Todd i Bri znowu wzajemnie doceniają swoją pracę. Czy to myślenie życzeniowe, czy ekipa Bushies rzeczywiście trafiła w końcu na bogate złoże?

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Napięcie rośnie, kiedy Craig i Taylor próbują przenieść 65-tonową wyciągarkę. Gloverowie zmieniają miejsce na górze Erie Mountain w regionie Salmo.

programme.title: Królowie złomu
programme.desc: W Lancashire trzeba przygotować do rozbiórki kościół z lat 50. XX w. Zanim budynek zniknie, trzeba usunąć z niego sprzęty — miedzy innymi stare pianino.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E02 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S4 Ep2
programme.desc: Squizzy odkrywa przyczynę swojej złej passy. Anonimowy żart pogłębia podziały między Bryce'em a szyprami. Snoddy ujawnia tajemnicę, która sprawia, że zmieniają się reguły gry.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E08 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep8
programme.desc: Zabytkowy most w Pensylwanii musi stawić czoła Matce Naturze. Nowojorską dzielnicą wstrząsa katastrofa budowlana. Zapada się szpitalny parking w Neapolu.

programme.sub-title: S04 : E02 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S4 Ep2

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Glen i Bill mają nadzieję na uratowanie starej, pordzewiałej furgonetki, a ich konkurent Robin robi wszystko, aby zdobyć części do swojej ciężarówki do przewozu mleka.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia S2 Ep6
programme.desc: Anthony uczy się szlifować kamienie szlachetne. Jodie sama schodzi pod ziemię. Richardsonowie kopią coraz głębiej, a ekipa Old Timers próbuje usunąć 500-kilogramowy głaz ze ściany szybu.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Craig i jego ekipa ratunkowa wycinają spalony fragment lasu na północ od Kamloops, ale niebezpieczna mieszanka popiołu i wody deszczowej fatalnie wpływa na maszyny i załogę.

programme.title: Królowie złomu
programme.desc: Osiedle komunalne w Oxfordshire ma być zburzone, ale prace spowalniają gniazdujące w nim ptaki i azbest. Stare samochody zamieniają się w tor przeszkód dla monster trucków.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Snoddy otrzymuje ofertę, która wiąże się z dużym połowem. Squizzy ma coraz większego pecha. Bryce stoi w obliczu ogromnej straty, jeśli jego rybackie szczęście się nie zmieni.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E09 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep9
programme.desc: Katastrofa uderza w przeprawę rzeczną w stanie Nowy Jork. Zawalenie się dźwigu wstrzymuje duży projekt kolejowy we Włoszech. W Szwecji robotnicy uciekają z walącego się mostu.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia S2 Ep6
programme.desc: Anthony uczy się szlifować kamienie szlachetne. Jodie sama schodzi pod ziemię. Richardsonowie kopią coraz głębiej, a ekipa Old Timers próbuje usunąć 500-kilogramowy głaz ze ściany szybu.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Zbliża się czas przebudowy furgonetki marki Divco, ale Bill ma poważny problem, który może zagrozić rywalizacji.

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.desc: Ray i Paul wracają do miejsca, z którego usunęli masywny głaz, aby sprawdzić, czy kryły się pod nim drogie kamienie. Anthony i Jodie wracają do Gemfields z nową energią i rodzinami.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Gloverowie walczą z trudnymi zimowymi warunkami na autostradzie. Kolejne awarie i kolizja mogę opóźnić pracę Craiga.

programme.title: Królowie złomu
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Fabryka karmy i samolot
programme.desc: W Suffolk ze starej fabryki karmy dla zwierząt wycieka dziwna, czarna ciecz. W Hampshire pasażerski Boeing 737 ma być przerobiony na meble.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E04 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S4 Ep4
programme.desc: Bryce desperacko próbuje zrealizować ważne zamówienie dla restauracji. Załoga kutra Bold Contender podejmuje ważną decyzję. Snoddy ryzykuje, powierzając dowodzenie swojemu nastoletniemu synowi.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E10 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep10
programme.desc: Nowy most w Ottawie okazuje się mieć słaby punkt. Jedna z najsłynniejszych budowli na świecie dzieli krytyków w Sydney. Co spowodowało zawalenie się jednego z najbardziej znanych włoskich mostów?

programme.title: Poszukiwacze klejnotów: Australia
programme.desc: Ray i Paul wracają do miejsca, z którego usunęli masywny głaz, aby sprawdzić, czy kryły się pod nim drogie kamienie. Anthony i Jodie wracają do Gemfields z nową energią i rodzinami.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Gloverowie walczą z trudnymi zimowymi warunkami na autostradzie. Kolejne awarie i kolizja mogę opóźnić pracę Craiga.

programme.desc: Stormhunters Mark and Jaclyn visit Canada's Arctic to see how the inhabitants live. Jaclyn also hopes to achieve one of her lifelong goals; to come face to face with a polar bear. Will she be able to cross this off her bucket list?

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: S01 : E24 Storm Hunters | Hurricane Havoc
programme.desc: They're no strangers to nature’s extremes but Hurricanes Harvey and Irma test the Stormhunters.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown

programme.desc: Are you ready to be taken on the ride of a lifetime as you journey through sandstorms, thunderstorms, and snow storms? I sure hope so, because that's what's in store here on another episode of Extreme Weather Countdown!

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E13 Extreme Weather Countdown | Storms for the Record Books
programme.desc: Record setting snowfall, tidal waves, rainfall, and flooding all make history in this noteworthy countdown.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 Extreme Weather Countdown | Come Hail or High Water
programme.desc: Today's forecast calls for gale force winds, fearsome tornadoes, and major flooding, all in a matter of minutes! Hold on tight, because it's time for another episode of Extreme Weather Countdown.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E02 Extreme Weather Countdown | Timber!

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S02 : E11 Extreme Weather Countdown | Cloudy With a Chance of Hurricanes

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S02 : E13 Extreme Weather Countdown | Thunderstruck
programme.desc: Batten down the hatches, open your umbrella, and get ready, because we're about to take you on one wild ride! Over the next half hour, you'll be pelted with hail, soaked by rain, and get blown away, as we showcase the most ferocious weather videos you've ever seen. programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S03 : E01 Angry Planet | Hurricane Triple Threat
programme.desc: “Angry Planet” is there as 3 storms make landfall as hurricanes in the US.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: No-one creates eco-disasters on quite the scale of the former Soviet Union. In Uzbekistan, the Aral Sea, once one of the largest freshwater lakes in the world, has seen its waters diverted, so that it has shrunk to 1/6 its previous size. In Crimea, a mountain has been carved into a james bondian submarine base. In northern Ukraine, the Chernobyl nuclear site has been reduced to a radioactive wasteland.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George returns to the “Fin Del Mundo” at the southern tip of Argentina, this time to sail on a Russian icebreaker to Antarctica. After braving the stormy Drake passage, he explores volcanic Deception Island, camps out in the Antarctic snow, and paddles a kayak through icebergs calved off the melting glaciers.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S03 : E07 Angry Planet | Polynesian Volcanoes
programme.desc: Filming the volcanoes, mudpools and geysers in the geothermic wonderland of New Zealand’s north island, we learn that a new island is being created by an undersea volcano 1000 miles north in Tonga. Determined to be among the first to see this “newest land on earth”, we head for the remote island by plane and boat, after various nautical mishaps, George ends up, bedraggled and clad in nothing but underwear and a lifejacket, honored to be one of the very first to explore this brand new island.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We break the bounds of earth, and look at the environment of space. We examine the difficulties and challenges of exploring this most challenging environment.↵ ↵George experiences some of the extreme training needed for space travel –aboard a Czech-built Albatross fighter jet, the Zero-G plane, and a centrifuge producing 6 G’s of force, and witnesses the launch of a flight to the International Space Station.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S03 : E11 Angry Planet | Crystal Cave
programme.desc: In 2000, a remarkable find was made in Chihuahua, Mexico, of a spectacular cave filled with giant crystals, some over 20 meters long. But it is a intensely difficult spot to explore – with temperatures over 50 degrees C and humidity well over 100%. George leads an Explorers Club Flag Expedition into the cave, wearing special refrigerated suits and respirators to battle the extreme environment.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The “Angry Planet” team hopes to film the natural wonders and extreme phenomena of this fascinating Central Asian country, including a spectacularly burning crater of natural gas, underground lakes, sandstorms and remnants of the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: For George Kourounis‚ ground zero for stormchasing is Oklahoma City, the capital of´Tornado Alley´.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Angry Planet | African Hellhole
programme.desc: The Angry Planet team heads to Africa to climb the steep and very active Nyiragongo Volcano in the Congo that erupted in 2002, sending 125,000 people fleeing for their lives. Host/adventurer George Kourounis explores the bubbling lake of molten lava and investigates the risk the dangerous volcano poses to both the people of city of Goma and the Mountain Gorillas who live on the nearby jungle slopes.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Angry Planet | The Winds of Autumn
programme.desc: The autumn of 2006 brings hurricanes to the North Atlantic and hot dry winds fan forest fires across Northern Ontario. Host/adventurer George Kourounis has traveled to some awesome hurricanes, including Rita and Katrina, with his pal Mark Robinson. This year they stormchase in Newfoundland, site of the hurricane that pulled Mark out of a life-threatening depression.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Angry Planet | Volcanic Wedding
programme.desc: Host George Kourounis has braved many terrifying phenomena – but none as frightening as the one he takes on in this episode: marriage! To make sure his new bride is on the same adventurous page with him, he proposes to get married on the lip of an exploding volcano, on the South Pacific island of Tanna, in Vanuatu. Before the native preacher, dressed in grass skirt and kustom garb, gets to perform the smoky vows, George descends into the erupting volcano to bring out red hot samples of the lava it is producing.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Avalanche danger is very high in the Rogers Pass area of the Trans Canada Highway in British Columbia. Host of Angry Planet George Kourounis travels with a variety of experts to bring down huge avalanches in the Rocky Mountains. Ski Patrollers throw hand charges to clear the slopes, the British Columbia Department of Highways uses helicopter bombing and mountaintop mortars to keep the roads safe, and the Canadian Armed Forces fire 105mm howitzers at the mountains to bring down the dangerous snow. Still, there are accidents and fatalities in the mountains. We meet Francois Desroisers, an avalanche burial victim who tells a terrible and tragic tale of a mountain disaster.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Angry Planet | Fin del Mundo
programme.desc: Some of the fiercest weather can be experienced at the area the South Americans call the “Fin del Mundo”.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Angry Planet | Midwest Stormfest
programme.desc: George returns to “Tornado Alley” with 3 fellow stormchasers to see what the 2007 Storm Season will bring.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Angry Planet | Wild Water Two
programme.desc: One of the most exciting episodes of season one is “Wild Water” – our look at Great White Sharks, water-filled caves and high voltage marine action.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We hope Season Two will give us the opportunity to make the quintessential Angry Planet show – a full episode exploring a major hurricane that makes landfall in Florida or the Carolinas.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: S01 : E29 Storm Hunters | Height of Ruin - Part 2
programme.desc: While in Nepal, the Stormhunters receive unexpected news that literally takes this trip to the next level. They contend with mountainous terrain, adverse weather and altitude sickness in their quest to glimpse Earth's highest mountain.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Storm Hunters | Dangerous Waters
programme.desc: The North Atlantic Ocean is generous with her bounty, until she takes a life in return. Mark braves the deep seas on the most dangerous day of the lobster fishing season.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Storm Hunters | Relentless Winter
programme.desc: Mark & Jaclyn chase extreme winter weather as Nor’easters hammer Atlantic Canada.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Storm Hunters | Heartache & Hope
programme.desc: It’s an ordinary town with a history of heartache. No one knows why Moore, Oklahoma has been the target of 3 mega-tornadoes in just 16 years. On the heels of the May 20, 2013 EF5 tornado, Mark & Jaclyn uncover stories behind the disaster, the recovery and the tenacious spirit of the people of the US Midwest.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Mission: Hurricane | Hurricane Dorian
programme.desc: In 2019, Josh Morgerman chased Hurricane Dorian in the Bahamas in what wound up becoming one of the most intense and dangerous storms he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Mission: Hurricane | Hat Trick
programme.desc: Josh Morgerman chased 3 typhoons in 6 days, a personal record amidst the Western Pacific's destructive forces.

programme.title: Sinister Storms
programme.sub-title: S03 : E09 Sinister Storms | Winds of Destruction
programme.desc: Hurricanes, firestorms, dust devils, and shifting grounds sweep through the land, leaving destruction.

programme.title: Sinister Storms
programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 Sinister Storms | The Unconquerable
programme.desc: Experience the transformative power of nature's most extremes.
